Comment: Sadly, I think that he actually means it.  The idea that he is a great dealmaker is core to his self-worth and self-image.  He constantly refers to this.  But he actually sucks at negotiation.  He isn't even mediocre at it, he is just bad at it.  Here, he violated one of the first rules of negotiation: He made it clear that he could not afford to walk away empty-handed.    That is never a good idea.  But it is particularly dumb when dealing with a maximalist such as Putin who will always try to pull everything to his side of the table and never try to find a middle ground.  These guys are hacks.  The Democrats should belittle them for it.  Americans across the board assume that the GOP is the better party for business and national security.  It should be the primary objective of the Democrats to take those branding messages for themselves, while mocking the GOP for being incompetent at both.
Author: I405CA
